, the capital. It is part of the

area, founded in 1683. The town population was 28,189 as of the 2000 census. It is known for its primarily Italian-American population. The shape of the town is vertically long, and split into three different areas: Foxon, the Center, and Momauguin. Foxon is the northernmost section and is surrounded Branford and North Branford as well as New Haven. The Center is not geographically the center of town, but contains the town hall, library, and the green, surrounded by a suburban area. Momauguin, to the south, borders New Haven along the coastline and contains the Tweed New Haven Regional Airport.

, and a commuter station an equal distance away in

value: A Civil War cannon, on the town green

. Includes displays and hands-on exhibits, a guided tour of nearly 100 vintage trolleys, as well as a variety of trolley rides along the historical Branford Electric Railway. Located at 17 River St. Telephone: 203-467-6927. Admission: adult $8, senior $6, child (2-5) $4. Family value: 2 adults and unlimited children $24. Children under 2 are free. April, November, December through the 17th: Sundays from10AM-5PM with trolleys running all day. May, September, October: Sat and Sun from 10AM-5PM. Summer hours (Memorial Day-Labor Day): every day from 10AM-5PM. Scheduling may vary, see website for details.
. Old East Haven High School 200 Tyler Avenue. Hours: Wednesday from 11AM to 2PM or by appointment.
. Bowling. Located at 525 Main St. Telephone: 203-467-6351.
. Located along Cosey Beach Ave. Includes picnic area, playground, volleyball and bocci courts. Fee for non-residents to park and use the beach.

value: Self-Guided Tour of East Haven Green

. Located where Main St. (Rt 100) and Hemingway Ave. meet. Across from 300 Hemingway Ave.

. In the fall, typically late September, the town hosts the Fall Festival in the center of town, where they set up merchant and food stands, carnival rides, band performances, a classic car show, and raffles.
On Independence Day, the town hosts a beach party on the East Haven Town Beach.
Every year the town has a popular Memorial Day Parade, and every fifth year it hosts the Columbus Day Parade, which is shared with five other cities and towns in southern Connecticut.

. Family-owned fine jewelry retailer. Custom-made and brand name items. Custom orders available. Jewelry and watch repair and polishing. You can bring in your old gold to sell to Palmer’s for cash. Located at 428 Main St. Telephone: +1 203-469-7553.

. A traditional Italian pastry shop specializing in wedding cakes. Located in the East Haven Mall, 190 Main St. Telephone: +1 203-469-1817. Hours: Tues-Sat 8:30-5:30, Sun 8:30-1:00, closed Monday. http://www.petonitospastryshop.com/

. Italian cuisine and grinders ranging from $6 to $20 depending on meal type, with most falling evenly in between. Normal and gourmet pizzas are available, as well as stuffed breads. Located at 346 Hemingway Ave. Telephone: +1 203-467-5694. Hours: Mon-Thurs 11AM-10PM, Fri-Sat 11AM-11PM, Sun 12PM-10PM.

. Classic Italian dishes with a modern twist. Prices are a bit on the high side, typically from $13 to $23 for meals, and a variety of wines available, both inexpensive and costly. Located at 672 Main St. Telephone: +1 203-469-2386. Hours: Tues-Fri Lunch 11:30AM-2PM Dinner 5PM-10PM, Sat Dinner 5PM-10PM, Sun Dinner 4PM-9PM, closed Monday.
. Italian restaurant, catering, and pizza. Located at 620 Coe Ave. Telephone: +1 203-467-4992.
. American cuisine; hamburgers, sandwiches, and seafood. Located at 383 Main St. Telephone: +1 203-469-8585.

. Traditional thin-crust pizza with a variety of toppings. Stuffed breads, calzones, Italian grinders, pasta dinners and more available. Located at 945 Foxon Rd. Telephone: +1 203-469-8404. Hours: Tues-Sat 11AM-10PM, Sun 12PM-9PM, closed Monday.

. Serves breakfast, lunch, dinner, dessert and has a kid’s menu. The menu is varied but sticks to traditional American/Southwestern foods typically found in diners. Located at 220 Main St. Telephone: +1 203-469-7433.

. Chain restaurant specializing in American and Southwestern cuisine. It has a very active yet cozy atmosphere and is a popular lunch and dinner spot for groups of friends, families, and parties. The service is generally friendly and fast. Some nights, such as Fridays and Saturdays, may be busy, and there is the possibility of a wait but usually not. Aside from the restaurant, there is a bar with sports TV. Located at 58 Frontage Rd. Telephone: +1 203-467-1533.
. Chinese take-out. Located at 214 Main St. Telephone: +1 203-469-8868. Hours: Mon-Thurs 11AM-11PM, Fri-Sat 11AM-11:30PM, Sun 12PM-10:30PM.
. Chinese take-out. Located at 452 Main St. Telephone: +1 203-469-1732. Hours: Mon-Thurs 11AM-11PM, Fri-Sat 11AM-11:30PM, Sun 12PM-10:30PM.

. 22 flavors! Also serves cakes and other frozen treats. The milkshakes are delicious. Located at 388 Main St. Telephone: +1 203-468-1573. Summer hours (Memorial to Labor day): 10AM – 10PM. Winter hours (Labor to Memorial Day): Tues-Thurs 11AM - 9PM, Fri 11AM - 10PM, Sat 10AM – 10PM, Sun 10AM-9PM, closed Monday. Closed Dec 25 – Jan 10.

A cute little pizza shop on the Foxon side of town. Since 1990 they have been serving Southern Italian recipes. They have catering and a great variety of food; anywhere from a salad to a pizza or eggplant parmesian. Located on 280 Foxon Rd. Telephone: (203)466-1550. Hours: Sun-Mon 3-9PM, Tues-Thurs 12-930PM Fri-Sat 12-10PM.
. Ecuadorian cuisine. Located at 460 Main St. Telephone: +1 203-467-9480.
. Italian cuisine. Located at 408 Main St. Telephone: +1 203-469-1764.

. Pizzeria and restaurant, also serving calzones, stuffed breads, subs, pasta, and other items. Though small, the place is nicely decorated and the service friendly, making it a cozy spot. The pizza's good, too! Located at 216A Main St. Telephone: +1 203-468-8995. Hours: Tues-Sat 11AM-10PM, Sun 3PM-9PM, closed Monday.
. Middle Eastern as well as American cuisine restaurant and delicatessen. Breakfast, lunch and dinner served. Prices are generally cheap, under $10. Located at 664 Coe Ave. Telephone: 203-466-2747.
. American restaurant and sports bar featuring barbeque. Take-out available. Located at 16 Main St. Telephone: +1 203-468-6695. Hours: Mon-Thurs 4PM-10PM, Fri 4PM-11PM, Sat 3PM-11PM, Sun 1PM-9PM.

. Mainly Italian cuisine. A small place, so reservations recommended. Prices range from $10 to $17, usually falling fairly in between. Located at 190 Main St. Telephone: +1 203-467-9498. Menu available:

. Specializes in seafood, yet carries other options such as steak, chicken and pasta dishes. Kids menu available. Restaurant area as well as front area to order ice cream and smaller meals. Popular spot for beach-goers, with the East Haven Beach is right across the street. Prices range from about $4 to $27 depending on meal type. Located at 161 Cosey Beach Ave. Telephone: +1 203-469-7544. Hours: Sun-Thurs 11AM-9PM, Fri-Sat 11AM-9:30PM.

. Brick oven pizza (normal and gourmet), wraps, grinders, and some Italian meal options ranging from $10 to $15. Lunch menu with wraps, burgers, and other items available all for under $10. It is beautifully decorated, inside and out, in a distinctly Mediterranean style. Includes a bar. Located at 410 Main St. Telephone: +1 203-469-9582.

. Large and varied menu with breakfast, lunch, dinner and dessert, along with a lot of specials. Typically good service and food. Price average is $10, give or take a few. Located at 34 Main St. Telephone: +1 203-468-6887.

. Mixed reviews, with some claiming there are filthy rooms. Location is next to a highway, so noise may be an issue. However, complimentary breakfast and coffee is included! All rooms come with air conditioning, cable television, and high speed internet. Outdoor swimming pool. Pets are accepted. Prices from $74 a night. Located at 30 Frontage Rd. Telephone: +1 203-469-5321.
